articles.author: KTAB Abilene
articles.summary: Trump announced the launch of StarGate, the largest AI infrastructure project in history, with the first site located in Abilene, Texas. It will invest at least $500 billion in AI infrastructure and create over 100,000 jobs. The data centers are already under construction.

articles.title: Abilene announced for largest AI infrastructure project with $500 billion+ investment
articles.summary: President Donald Trump has unveiled the largest AI infrastructure project in history, with the first site located in Abilene, Texas. This project aligns with Lancium, a clean energy computing company that began construction of its clean energy data center there in 2022. The data center will host multiple clients from various tech sectors, the first focusing on artificial intelligence. Larry Ellison, Executive Chairman of Oracle, Masayoshi Son, CEO of SoftBank, and Sam Altman, Chief Executive of OpenAI are also involved in the project.

articles.title: And Now Trump Says He Has a $500 Billion AI Cure for Cancer
articles.author: David Gardner
articles.summary: Donald Trump's day two pledge was to cure cancer through an artificial intelligence initiative with $500 billion in private sector investment. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, Softbank Group CEO Masayoshi Son and Oracle Corp Chairman Larry Ellison are working on an AI-based cancer vaccine.

articles.title: Trump announces $500 billion AI investment for new data centers, jobs
articles.author: Mallory Wilson
articles.summary: Mr. Trump announced a multibillion-dollar artificial intelligence infrastructure deal with private tech companies. OpenAI, Softbank and Oracle are teaming up for a joint venture called Stargate. Mr. Trump predicts the planned data centers will create more than 100,000 jobs in the U.S. The first project will be a data center in Texas.

articles.title: Texas legislation considers AI rules for health insurance claims
articles.author: Sarah Al-Shaikh
articles.summary: Texas lawmaker files bill to regulate artificial intelligence. SB 815 would prohibit health insurance companies from using AI to delay, deny or modify claims. There have been reports of insurance companies using AI for process claims and review prior authorization requests. American Medical Association adopted a policy calling for more oversight of AI in prior authorization in June 2023.

articles.title: UW study of how AI models portray teens finds strong negative associations
articles.author: Kurt Schlosser
articles.summary: The research was presented at the AAAI/ACM Conference on AI, Ethics and Society in San Jose, California. It compared AI systems trained in English and Nepali to one trained on data from different cultures. In English-language systems, around 30% of the AI system responses about teens referenced societal problems such as violence, drug use and mental illness. The Nepali system was closer to 10%. The researchers held workshops with groups of teens from the U.S. and Nepal and found that neither group felt that an AI system trained on media data containing stereotypes about teens would accurately represent them.

articles.title: Apple Intelligence is enabled by default in iOS 18.3 and macOS 15.3
articles.author: Mac World
articles.summary: With iOS 18.3 and macOS 15.3, Apple's AI features become a standard default part of the experience for all compatible iPhones (iPhone 15 Pro and Pro Max, iPhone 16, iPads, and Macs with M1 or later processors) According to the developer documentation, Apple Intelligence will be enabled by default during iPhone onboarding. To disable Apple Intelligence, open Settings, select Apple Intelligence & Siri, and flip the toggle switch to turn it off.

articles.title: Perplexity launches Sonar, world's most affordable search API to rival Google
articles.author: Kapil Kajal
articles.summary: Perplexity has launched the world's most affordable search API, Sonar, on Tuesday. This new API service enables businesses and developers to integrate its generative AI search tools into their applications. Perplexity secured $73.6 million in funding earlier this month, bringing its total valuation to approximately $520 million.

articles.title: Trump, Larry Ellison unveil AI project that'll get start in Texas
articles.author: Will Anderson
articles.summary: Stargate Project is a $500 billion investment over four years to build massive data centers for artificial intelligence research in the United States. It will get its start in Abilene, Texas. Oracle Corp. is leasing a 200-megawatt data center there. SoftBank Corp. will invest $100 billion in the project.

OpenAI, Softbank and Oracle launched the project, called Stargate, to unleash the new technology with the help of large data centers based in Texas. Trump said the project should create around 100,000 new jobs and will 'ensure the future of technology' in the US.

articles.title: Trump-approved partnership with Open AI
articles.author: Robin Westenra
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman will give a demonstration of a new PhD-level AI to US officials in a closed-door meeting on January 30. OpenAI, Softbank and Oracle are the initial equity investors. Middle East AI fund MGX, Microsoft, Nvidia and Arm are also involved in the tech project. The president called it the 'greatest AI infrastructure project by far in history' and it will create over 100,000 U.S. jobs.

articles.title: Truegenics Revolutionizes Customer Service with AI Assistant ‘Madison', Achieving 76% Automation Rate in Digital Transformation Journey

Salesforce's "Agentforce" can help provide support to both employees and customers. ServiceNow helps businesses automate business processes.

articles.title: How can we design humane autonomous systems? Experts share insight in book
articles.author: Science X staff
articles.summary: "Humane autonomous technology" is an open access book by a group of scholars. It offers a critical examination of AI and autonomous systems from a human-centered perspective. The book is divided into four themes: labor, co-work and industry, cognition and emotion, humanness and values, art, design and visual culture, and the design of automation for work enrichment.

articles.title: Why skilled trades are safe from AI
articles.author: Gettysburg Times
articles.summary: Many jobs are going to be eliminated by artificial intelligence. It's going to happen sooner rather than later, because of the speed at which AI is evolving. It will be very difficult to replace human workers with AI.    iReport.com will let you know how it goes.

It will help with tasks including summarizing or proofreading emails or translating code from one language to another. Wall Street has embraced AI faster than any other disruptive technology in recent years.

The agency is looking to declassify and expose its secrets to help procure private sector contracts.

articles.title: The CIA Is Quietly Using AI to Emulate World Leaders
